revised_title: Researches on Tides: Thirteenth Series - On the Tides of the Pacific and the Diurnal Inequality
tldr: The author investigates the tides of the Pacific Ocean and the diurnal inequality, analyzing extensive tide observations and discussing the limitations of drawing cotidal lines across wide oceans. The study reveals that tides in the mid-ocean are generally small, and suggests that a stationary undulation may be a more accurate representation of oceanic tides.
